title: Fixes clippy complaint when using the nightly toolchain
Fix/draggable offset position
body:
The current implementation of `use_draggable` only works for
elements with a fixed position where the boundaries are relative
to the window.

In order to support other positions, we need to generalize the
offset calculation so a user can provide its own function.

Fix https://github.com/Synphonyte/leptos-use/issues/107

title: feat: add month_by_date for use_calendar
body: added month_by_date function allowing show arbitrary month by date (useful when building date picker)

title: feat: update to `leptos@0.8.0-beta`
body:
### Description

Keeping track of latest `leptos@0.8.0-beta` releases.

title: Update to `leptos@0.8.0-alpha`
body:
# Description

- Remove references to the `leptos-spin` dependency which hasn't received updates in a while and is still stuck on `leptos@0.6`.
- Update to `rand@0.9`.

This pull request is to keep track track of the `leptos@0.8` updates. 

I'm happy to make changes requested.

title: Fixed small issue in websocket example
body:
It looks like there were two method-calls missing.
After adding them the code runs fine.

title: fix:  More reliable delay during hydration for use_storage
body:
Under some circumstances, the stored value would be overridden by default even with delay_during_hydration.  I don't know what steps reproduce this issue - it occurs in one of my projects and not another project.

Use flag to prevent setting the value before the request_animation_frame callback runs

title: Update rand requirement from 0.8 to 0.9

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

body:
Updates the requirements on [rand](https://github.com/rust-random/rand) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from rand's changelog.

[0.9.0] - 2025-01-27

Security and unsafe

  • Policy: "rand is not a crypto library" (#1514)
  • Remove fork-protection from ReseedingRng and ThreadRng. Instead, it is recommended to call ThreadRng::reseed on fork. (#1379)
  • Use zerocopy to replace some unsafe code (#1349, #1393, #1446, #1502)

Dependencies

  • Bump the MSRV to 1.63.0 (#1207, #1246, #1269, #1341, #1416, #1536); note that 1.60.0 may work for dependents when using --ignore-rust-version
  • Update to rand_core v0.9.0 (#1558)

Features

  • Support std feature without getrandom or rand_chacha (#1354)
  • Enable feature small_rng by default (#1455)
  • Remove implicit feature rand_chacha; use std_rng instead. (#1473)
  • Rename feature serde1 to serde (#1477)
  • Rename feature getrandom to os_rng (#1537)
  • Add feature thread_rng (#1547)

API changes: rand_core traits

  • Add fn RngCore::read_adapter implementing std::io::Read (#1267)
  • Add trait CryptoBlockRng: BlockRngCore; make trait CryptoRng: RngCore (#1273)
  • Add traits TryRngCore, TryCryptoRng (#1424, #1499)
  • Rename fn SeedableRng::from_rng -> try_from_rng and add infallible variant fn from_rng (#1424)
  • Rename fn SeedableRng::from_entropy -> from_os_rng and add fallible variant fn try_from_os_rng (#1424)
  • Add bounds Clone and AsRef to associated type SeedableRng::Seed (#1491)

API changes: Rng trait and top-level fns

  • Rename fn rand::thread_rng() to rand::rng() and remove from the prelude (#1506)
  • Remove fn rand::random() from the prelude (#1506)
  • Add top-level fns random_iter, random_range, random_bool, random_ratio, fill (#1488)
  • Re-introduce fn Rng::gen_iter as random_iter (#1305, #1500)
  • Rename fn Rng::gen to random to avoid conflict with the new gen keyword in Rust 2024 (#1438)
  • Rename fns Rng::gen_range to random_range, gen_bool to random_bool, gen_ratio to random_ratio (#1505)
  • Annotate panicking methods with #[track_caller] (#1442, #1447)

API changes: RNGs

  • Fix <SmallRng as SeedableRng>::Seed size to 256 bits (#1455)
  • Remove first parameter (rng) of ReseedingRng::new (#1533)

API changes: Sequences

  • Split trait SliceRandom into IndexedRandom, IndexedMutRandom, SliceRandom (#1382)
  • Add IndexedRandom::choose_multiple_array, index::sample_array (#1453, #1469)

API changes: Distributions: renames

  • Rename module rand::distributions to rand::distr (#1470)
  • Rename distribution Standard to StandardUniform (#1526)
  • Move distr::Slice -> distr::slice::Choose, distr::EmptySlice -> distr::slice::Empty (#1548)
  • Rename trait distr::DistString -> distr::SampleString (#1548)
  • Rename distr::DistIter -> distr::Iter, distr::DistMap -> distr::Map (#1548)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 96f8df6 Prepare 0.9.0 release (#1558)
  • 34da321 Enable stdarch_x86_avx512 for cpu has avx512bw (#1551)
  • b4b1eb7 Re-org with distr::slice, distr::weighted modules (#1548)
  • 16eb7de Add the thread_rng feature flag (#1547)
  • afa24e4 Fix test status badges (#1544)
  • c681dfc Create FUNDING.yml
  • 9f05e22 Update: getrandom v0.3.0 rc.0 (#1541)
  • 88c310b Fix docs.rs build options (#1539)
  • b879689 Adjust GH Actions (#1538)
  • 3fac49f Prepare 0.9.0-beta.0 (#1535)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

You can trigger a rebase of this PR by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---

body:
Updates the requirements on [getrandom](https://github.com/rust-random/getrandom) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from getrandom's changelog.

[0.2.15] - 2024-05-06

Added

  • Apple visionOS support #410

Changed

  • Use libc::getrandom on DragonflyBSD, FreeBSD, illumos, and Solaris #411 #416 #417 #420
  • Unify libc::getentropy-based implementations #418

#410: rust-random/getrandom#410 #411: rust-random/getrandom#411 #416: rust-random/getrandom#416 #417: rust-random/getrandom#417 #418: rust-random/getrandom#418 #420: rust-random/getrandom#420

[0.2.14] - 2024-04-08

Fixed

  • Enable /dev/urandom fallback for MUSL-based Linux targets #408

#408: rust-random/getrandom#408

[0.2.13] - 2024-04-06

Added

  • linux_disable_fallback crate feature to disable /dev/urandom-based fallback on Linux and Android targets. Enabling this feature bumps minimum supported Linux kernel version to 3.17 and Android API level to 23 (Marshmallow). #396

Changed

  • Disable /dev/urandom fallback for Linux targets outside of the following target_arches: aarch64, arm, powerpc, powerpc64, s390x, x86, x86_64 #396
  • Do not catch EPERM error code on Android while checking availability of the getrandom syscall #396

#396: rust-random/getrandom#396

[0.2.12] - 2024-01-09

Fixed

  • Custom backend for targets without atomics #385

Changed

  • Improve robustness of the Hermit backend and sys_fill_exact #386
  • Raise minimum supported Apple OS versions to macOS 10.12 and iOS 10 #388

Added

  • Document platform support policy #387

#385: rust-random/getrandom#385 #386: rust-random/getrandom#386 #387: rust-random/getrandom#387 #388: rust-random/getrandom#388

  • a24538f Remove .cargo/config (#421)

  • 924c88d Unconditionally use libc::getrandom on Illumos and libc::geentropy on Sol...

  • dca4961 Unconditionally use libc::getrandom on FreeBSD (#416)
  • d4b0ef0 Use libc::getrandom on DragonflyBSD (#411)
  • 0d55923 Add Apple visionOS support (#410)
  • a39033a Enable /dev/urandom fallback for MUSL-based Linux targets (#408)
  • 968dd48 Release v0.2.13 (#405)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: impl Clone + Copy for UseDropZoneReturn
body:
in my use case i have to destruct and construct UseDropZoneReturn whenever i want to clone it
and the contents of this struct implement copy anyway so i implemented Copy to make my life easier

title: Cleaned up cruft in `signal_debounced` example.
body: Left over from PR #208.

title: Add `*_local` variants for filtered signals.
body: Implemented and tested for `debounce`.

title: ISSUE-180 - Make sure the remove button actually removes the values from the storage
body:
The code was correctly removing the key from the storage.

However, a call to fetch_from_storage was being made as a callback.
fetch_from_storage, in turn, was setting back the default value for the Struct, which in turn triggered the code to create the item again on the local storage.
I removed the code that was setting the default value when it was not found.
Now in order to re-add the values, we have to refresh the page.
I'd recommend maybe later add a button to re-insert the values after being deleted.

title: Update to stable Leptos 0.7
body:
The [first stable version of Leptos 0.7](https://github.com/leptos-rs/leptos/releases/tag/v0.7.0) was just released, so I figure I'd take the liberty of bumping the dependency.

I also updated the `wasm-bindgen` and `web-sys` crates to their most recent versions.

title: Fix order of language checks in `use_locale`
body:
This builds upon #199, because the code overlaps.

Currently, the matching algorithm does it best to try to match the first _supported_ languages, instead of prioritizing matching the first _client_ languages, which would be the more useful behavior.

So, for example, if the user declares it accepts Chinese first, English second; but the application support English first, Chinese second; then, the first supported language, English, will be matched, even though the user would prefer Chinese.

This change inverts the order in which the languages are checked so that the supported languages are exhausted before moving to the next client one.

I'm assuming the `clone` on the Peekable iterator is cheap, but honestly I'm not entirely sure.

title: Prevent crashes on `use_locale`
body:
Currently, on `use_locale`, if the server receives a malformed `Accept-Language` header, it will panic: <https://github.com/Synphonyte/leptos-use/blob/a1bac85023e26a3079a19657d687e27cfadfeeed/src/use_locale.rs#L79>

Changed it so the offending language (or the entire header, see `use_locales`) is ignored and a warning is logged instead.

The current implementation will also panic if there are no client languages whatsoever. Fixed that case too.

I tried to do it in such a way as to minimize clones.

body:
Bumps [actions/configure-pages](https://github.com/actions/configure-pages) from 3 to 5.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/configure-pages's releases.

v5.0.0

Breaking Changes

:warning: This version contains breaking changes! :warning:

  • When using the input param static_site_generator: next:
    • Added support for Next.js >= 13.3.0
    • Consequently, also dropped support for Next.js < 13.3.0

Full Changelog

  • Attempt to auto-detect configuration files with varying file extensions @​JamesMGreene (#139)
  • Convert errors into Actions-compatible logging with annotations @​JamesMGreene (#138)
  • Bump @​actions/github from 5.1.1 to 6.0.0 @​dependabot (#123)
  • Bump the non-breaking-changes group with 2 updates @​dependabot (#136)
  • Update the Next.js configuration for v14 @​JamesMGreene (#137)
  • Bump the non-breaking-changes group with 3 updates @​dependabot (#132)
  • Bump release-drafter/release-drafter from 5 to 6 @​dependabot (#133)
  • Bump github/codeql-action from 2 to 3 @​dependabot (#127)
  • Bump actions/checkout from 3 to 4 @​dependabot (#120)
  • Bump actions/setup-node from 3 to 4 @​dependabot (#118)
  • Bump the non-breaking-changes group with 1 update @​dependabot (#131)
  • Update Dependabot config to group non-breaking changes @​JamesMGreene (#130)

See details of all code changes since previous release.

v4.0.0

Changelog

  • Use a centralized .node-version file @​JamesMGreene (#117)
  • Update action to node20 @​takost (#108)

See details of all code changes since previous release.

v3.0.7

Changelog

  • Update Actions workflows to use Node 20.x @​JamesMGreene (#116)
  • Bump eslint-plugin-github from 4.7.0 to 4.10.1 @​dependabot (#114)
  • Bump word-wrap from 1.2.3 to 1.2.5 @​dependabot (#113)
  • Bump jest from 29.5.0 to 29.7.0 @​dependabot (#112)

See details of all code changes since previous release.

title: fix: unpinning web-sys
body: This PR unpins the `web-sys` crate version to be in sync with `leptos`.

title: Fix Clippy Warnings for Leptos 0.7
body: I was taking a look at this project and kept getting a bunch of warnings when I ran `cargo check`. This PR fixes all the warnings from running `cargo check` and `cargo clippy`.

title: Fix MediaTrackConstraints dependency
body:
After  #183 (Thanks, BTW!), the crate does not build with `--no-default-features --features use_user_media`. It looks like the `web-sys/MediaTrackConstraints` dependency accidentally ended up in the `use_web_notification` feature block. I swapped it to `use_user_media` block and tested with:

```shell
cargo build --no-default-features --features use_user_media && \
cargo build --no-default-features --features use_web_notification
```

title: Unpin `wasm-bindgen` version
body:
Unpin `wasm-bingen` to be compatible with `leptos-0.7.0-rc1`. See https://github.com/leptos-rs/leptos/pull/3186.

Fixes https://github.com/Synphonyte/leptos-use/issues/176

title: ssr cookie bug fixes
body:
i noticed the library is unnecessarily setting cookies on the server side and also skipping cookies that should be set on initial page loads

this PR is the fixes i came up with

title: Fix import issues with leptos version 0.7.0-gamma2
body:
The newest leptos version as of today's date has had some of its modules renamed, this pull request is a simple search and replace of
"reactive_graph" -> "reactive"
and
"leptos::spawn" -> "leptos::task"

The project now compiles again. All cargo tests pass except for this one:

test src/use_cookie.rs - use_cookie::use_cookie 

But I'm unsure if this is related to the newest version of leptos

title: fix: notify from trigger (0.7 beta change)
body: Fix for breaking change in leptos `0.7-beta5`

title: Use `version = "0.7-beta"` instead of `git`
body: `version = "0.7-beta"` pulls in the most current beta crate version - better than using master branch

title: Fix 0.7 compilation error
body: Fixes:  `use of undeclared crate or module 'diagnostics'`

title: Fix the request context for actix web
body:
For the Send/Sync changes in Leptos, `actix_web::HttpRequest` is now wrapped in `leptos_actix::Request`

I've only looked into actix, I don't know if anything changed with axum or spin.

title: Fixed some imports
body: Some modules were removed from the leptos prelude, so I fixed the path.

title: Allow for lazy protocols with use_websocket
body:
I have a need to use the `protocols` option of websockets, but I can only get them asyncronously. This PR provides a way to have "async" protocols by wrapping `Option<Vec<String>>` in `MaybeSignal`. Combining e.g. an async resource as the protocol signal with `opts.immediate(false)` and manually calling `ws.open()` once the resource has loaded solves the issue.

This is definitely a weird implementation though, if you have a better way to do it I can update the PR?

This shouldn't be a breaking change, all previous config of the protocol option should be unaffected, due to the `impl Into<MaybeSignal<...>>`

title: bugfix: error when cleanup happens after reconnect attempt is on timeout
body:
Console error:
```
panicked at /.../.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/leptos-use-0.12.0/src/use_websocket.rs:314:68:
could not get stored value
```

Note:  I tested this as working when cherry-picked into `v0.12.0`, but trying to compile my project with `main` branch fails so this hasn't been able to be testing on main.

title: Fixed an untyped into causing compilation error
body: Also fixed some warnings.

title: Fixed a deadlock with `use_cookie`
body: The cookie update while in the `update_value` function was causing a deadlock for the arena access, moved the cookie set outside of the closure.

title: Feat: Enhance UseWebNotificationOptions and ShowOptions with additional field
body: - Added `vibration` field to allow specifying vibration patterns for notifications.

title: Feat: Add prefers-reduced-motion API implementation
body:
Introduced `use_prefers_reduced_motion` function to create a reactive interface for detecting the user's reduced motion preference.

Updated documentation for `use_preferred_contrast`, `use_media_query`, and `use_preferred_dark` functions to include See also references.

Resolves #149

title: fixed an error for a match on a non exhaustive enum
body:
Prior to `wasm-bindgen v0.2.93`, `#[wasm_bindgen]` on an enum made it "non-exhaustive" by adding a `__Nonexhaustive` variant, with the new release of `v0.2.93` it does'nt introduce that variant anymore and just use `#[non_exhaustive]`. This PR solves this issue, for both prior versions and incoming version of `wasm-bindgen`.

I did a quick search and this is the only instance of the use of this "fake" variant in the codebase.

title: Rework of `UseMouseCoordType`
body:
I was unhappy with how `UseMouseCoordType` and `UseMouseEventExtractor` were setup, and especially I did not like the "useless" existence of `UseMouseEventExtractorDefault`.

This makes the following changes:
1. `UseMouseEventExtractorDefault` is removed.
2. `UseMouseCoordType<E>` now has a `Default` implementation for the type `UseMouseCoordType<Infallible>`.

title: `LocalStorage` integration
body:
Here's another _significant_ PR. Hopefully we can avoid any such sweeping changes going forward.

This PR integrates the new `Storage` concept for signals. Anything that was trivially wrapped in a `SendWrapper` has now been converted to make use of `LocalStorage`.

~~This now compiles with my [leptos branch that includes custom events](https://github.com/CorvusPrudens/leptos/tree/leptos_0.7_event), which has a PR waiting on approval leptos-rs/leptos#2762.~~ This should now work with Leptos's main branch and the upcoming `beta2` release.

I also swapped the type order for `ElementMaybeSignal::Static` from `Option<SendWrapper<T>>` to `SendWrapper<Option<T>>`, removing the need for cloning in a few places. I did something similar for `ElementMaybeSignals` as well.

There are probably several places where the bounds on types are overly strict. For example, `watch_with_options` does not have a `local` implementation. If there's a good approach for this in general, it might be nice to look into. I imagine people will often want to use many of these utilities with `!Send` types.

The two things that have not yet been ported are:

1. `From<HtmlElement<El>> for ElementMaybeSignal` and similar
2. `use_active_element`

Both of these rely on the old, eager Leptos element architecture to varying degrees. They'll need some assessment and will require more effort to port than the rest of the code.

I didn't notice there was more work on the upstream since my last commits. Hopefully my merge didn't step on anyone's toes!

title: Feat: Enhance `UseWebNotificationOptions` and `ShowOptions` with additional fields
body:
- Added `renotify` field to `UseWebNotificationOptions` and `ShowOptions`, uncommenting existing code to enable re-notification functionality.
- Added `silent` field to control whether notifications are displayed silently.
- Added `image` field to allow specifying an image for notifications.

title: Fix `web_sys_unstable_apis` not passed to rustdoc
body: Resolves #105. See https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/9138#issuecomment-774074873

title: Fix Setup Rust toolchain step on ci.yml
chore: integrity checks for nightly/stable
body:
This is a proposal on improving integrity checks for both Rust toolchains `stable` and
`nightly`. This is attempted to be executed before merging a PR.

Basically current `ci.yml` is moved to `cd.yml` as it contains releasing steps,
and `ci.yml` now performs code integration steps.

title: Make rustdoc links work with the book
body:
This PR contains the following changes:

- Fix all warnings building the rustdoc documentation. Mostly internal crossreferenced urls. To make them work with the book, a new Python function has been added to the `post_build.py` script, which rewrites the urls in the generated HTML files.
- Rename `BreakpointsSematic` to `BreakpointsSemantic` and `breakpoints_sematic` to `breakpoints_semantic` (note the `n`). This is a breaking change.

title: Progress towards Leptos 0.7.0-alpha
body:
This PR makes progress towards updating `leptos-use` for Leptos 0.7 (now on `0.7.0-alpha`).

Given the extensive nature of these changes, this PR may be impractical from a review standpoint. However, it may at least be useful as a point of reference for what needs to be done.

There are four main blockers at the moment:
1. It appears [queue_microtasks](https://docs.rs/leptos/latest/leptos/fn.queue_microtask.html) is not yet implemented in 0.7
2. `watch` is not yet implemented in 0.7 [as noted here on Discord](https://discord.com/channels/1031524867910148188/1234308989970550834/1263091619339436065).
3. There is no equivalent to [leptos::ev::Custom](https://docs.rs/leptos/latest/leptos/ev/struct.Custom.html). This may simply be an oversight, as it appears to be very simple.
4. The `HtmlElement` struct has gotten [much more complicated](https://docs.rs/leptos/0.7.0-alpha/leptos/html/struct.HtmlElement.html) and I'm not sure what the best approach is for managing `ElementMaybeSignal`-related code.

With all this in mind, it seems like the most helpful way forward would be implementing the missing items in 1-3, and that might be pretty easy!

In any case, I hope this helps!

title: Fix: use_cookie demo button misalignment
body: resolves #102

title: Uses caller tracking for filtered signals for better warning reporting.
body: Resolves Issue #129 by tracking the caller location of filtered signals for use in "outside reactive context" warnings.

title: Feat: Add getUserMedia API implementation
body:
Introduced `use_user_media` function and structure to create a reactive streaming interface for media input devices.

Closes #128

title: Make `use_derive_signal!` public
body: Fixes #125

title: Fix typo in use_cookie compile errors.
body: The original messages read as requiring both features to be enabled at the same time instead of requiring one or the other - not both - to be enabled.

title: add impls into `web_sys::HtmlElement` for `ElementMaybeSignal`
body: Not used anywhere yet but it could be useful later on if you decide to extract `ElementMaybeSignal` into a separate crate

title: Fix document.set_cookie usage
body:
Setting `document.cookie` only supports [setting a single cookie at a time](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/cookie#write_a_new_cookie). Currently `use_cookie` will try to set multiple cookies by serializing the whole cookie jar. This PR fixes setting and deleting cookies from the client, and adds a second counter to the `use_cookie` example. This example is broken with the current `use_cookie` implementation and works correctly in this branch.

Unfortunately `cookie` uses `time` so `jar.remove` doesn't work in WASM, which makes the implementation a bit awkward (have to first add the cookie with value="" and expires=0, and then afterward call `jar.force_remove`)

title: time unit of cookie's max-age is actually millisecond
body: got bited

title: Fix SSR detection from an url query parameter for `use_color_mode`
body: I missed that on #79. Currently panics when compiling if `initial_value_from_url_param` is `true` on the server.

title: Add methods to UseDocument
body:
Added methods in the order they appear on the website discussed (for convenience) up to `preferred_style_sheet_set`.

@maccesch please let me know how all this looks and I'll keep chipping away at them!

title: Add ssr feature note to the book
body:
I wasn't aware of Leptos' SSR build process, and enabled the `leptos-use` feature globally. Because of this I ended up with the server version of the functions in the client, which obviously did not work.

See #83 for context.

title: Fix `.demo-source` docs links
body: The "Source" button of the clipboard demo can't be easily clicked at https://leptos-use.rs/browser/use_clipboard.html

title: Add options to discover initial color mode from URL param
body:
Closes #78

I'm not sure if this is the best way to implement it, but seems to work fine. Suggestions would be appreciated.

title: Don't deploy book to Github Pages on pull requests
body: Fixes https://github.com/Synphonyte/leptos-use/actions/runs/7803407302/job/21283109692

title: Prefer signals over memos with first unused argument when possible
body: Use [`impl Fn() -> T + 'static`](https://docs.rs/leptos/latest/leptos/struct.Signal.html#method.derive) instead of [`impl Fn(Option<&T>) -> T + 'static`](https://docs.rs/leptos/latest/leptos/fn.create_memo.html) when possible.

title: Use previous Trunk version in CI and apply clippy suggestions
body:
- Install Trunk v0.17.5, next versions are breaking the build because they are not generating the starting `<head>` element on examples.
- Apply clippy suggestions.

title: Add `use_device_orientation`
body: See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DeviceOrientationEvent and https://solidjs-use.github.io/solidjs-use/core/useDeviceOrientation

title: Added use-cookie
body:
Fixes #33 

Finally got the time for it.

Let me know if this implementation is okay. If it is, I'll add the docs for it

title: Add `use_device_pixel_ratio`
body: Closes #60

title: seanaye/use display media
body:
- add use_display_media
- fix the example via template

title: Remove logging of WS url
body: Removes an unnecessary (probably debugging) logging statement.

title: Problem: mdbook use_service_worker script is not portable
body:
I've been having trouble building the mdbook with `python3 post_build.py`. This was failing for two reasons.

The first was that bash was being called with a command string "./post_build.sh" for the use_service_worker. I've changed this to rely on calling the file directly by removing -c option. The second was that the bash script was relying on `#! /bin/bash`. I'm on NixOS which doesn't have a /bin/bash.

So this PR should make the mdbook build scripts more portable.

title: Remove use of --cfg=web_sys_unstable_apis
body:
ResizeObserver was stabilised in wasm-bindgen [0.2.87](https://github.com/rustwasm/wasm-bindgen/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)

This PR removes usage of `--cfg=web_sys_unstable_apis`, enables `use_resize_observer` plus `use_element_size` and cleans up a failing test.

title: Improve use_storage and removing storage flag
body:
The use_storage API is great but there are a few issues with it:

* It is locked behind the storage feature.
* It requires usage of serde, a large dependency.
* Versioning is done with `merge_defaults` and is pure string replacement.
* It fails if the storage is disabled.
* There is possibly a race condition between an internal and global storage event.

This is a merge request to improve on these points.

The API now requires a codec to be specified. This codec specifies how a value should be encoded and decoded to the browser API. I've introduced the following codecs:
* StringCodec: a simple parser relies on FromStr and ToString. Used by default and works with primitive values. Doesn't require a feature flag.
* JsonCodec: parses the value as JSON. Usage of this codec is the same as before and uses the "serde" feature.
* ProstCodec: parses the value as a protocol buffer message. This is a codec that handles versioning and uses the "prost" feature.

By using a codec, the API can be used without enabling any features:
```
let (count, set_count, remove) = use_local_storage::<i32, StringCodec>("my-count");
```

JSON can be used just as easily. It also expands to any struct that implements Serialize, Deserialize as before:
```
let (count, set_count, remove) = use_session_storage::<i32, JsonCodec>("my-count-kept-in-js");
```

I've had to make changes to the API to support this. I've tried to keep the same functionality as before. General high-level changes to the API:
* The `use_storage_with_options` is the base fn that takes a StorageType, key and options. This forces a choice between local / session / custom whose semantics are different rather than relying on a default.
* The `use_local_storage` and `use_session_storage` (and those having the _with_options suffix) call into `use_storage_with_options`.
* Instead of passing a default, `UseStorageOptions` provides a default signal that uses `T::default` if not provided.
* `write_defaults` was removed as it wasn't obvious what should happen if the storage was deleted. If the storage item is removed, the value reverts back to the default signal.
* `merge_defaults` was removed as it's a choice made by the codec.

Other points of interest:
* The storage feature flag has been removed.
* These changes touch `use_color_mode` which can now attempts data persistence without the storage feature.
* There's a fallback to just using signals if browser storage is disabled. It acts a lot like a lesser session storage.
* In the original design, values are passed and read from the event. I wasn't sure how these global events interacted from multiple tabs as well as internal events. So I switched the read signal to be a memo that calls storage.get_item when notified by an external event. This should avoid any data races from competing events.

Things I think that need your careful consideration:
* Added `thiserror` dependency. It's a small, macro dependency but a dependency nevertheless.
* Missing guidance on how to replace `merge_defaults`. This could just be an example on how to implement Codec and manipulating the JSON string as before. Or another JsonValueCodec that gives you access to the Serde::Value to make better default decisions than string replace. Your input here would be useful. It might also be obvious as the Codec trait is rather simple and might not need anything.
* The default value of `UseColorModeOptions::storage_enabled` flips based on whether the storage flag was enabled. Since this flag has gone away and is now effectively always enabled, it will flip to true for users not previously using storage. I think this is reasonable but might be a surprise.
* I tried using the default_builder macros but this resulted in an error related to the codecs. So I kept it as the manual builder pattern.
* The `UseStorageOptions::default_value` is a `MaybeRwSignal` but only the read portion is used. I kept it as rw because it impacted the colour mode API and I wanted to avoid the ripple effect of changing too many APIs.

Please let me know what you think and give any feedback as necessary. I'm more than happy to make changes and tweaks as needed. I am away this week so my time is limited but I will try to do what I can.

title: Add use_service_worker

labels.name: new function
labels.description: Add a new function to the lib

body:
This adds the `use_service_worker` function, which makes it easier to work with service workers by providing a set of signals and callbacks which conveniently tell your application when a service worker is active and a new one is awaiting its activation and allows you to activate an awaiting SW with a simple `sw.skip_waiting.call(())`.
A user provided callback is used to handle a new activation. This is a full page reload unless specified otherwise.

title: Replace all occurrences of AddEventListenerOptions with UseEventListenerOptions
body: It seems that a few places were not covered with the latest commit.

title: Stable Rust docs
body:
Hello,
I just wanted to draw attention to this deprecated part of the getting started section. Feel free to reword it in any way appropriate. But I am sure I am not the only one that prefers to use stable rust, especially for trying out the libraries.

title: Add `use_websocket`
body:
Highly inspired by [`use_websocket`](https://github.com/jetli/yew-hooks/blob/main/crates/yew-hooks/src/hooks/use_websocket.rs) of [`yew-hooks`](https://github.com/jetli/yew-hooks)

## Content
- [x] `use_websocket`
- [x] `use_websocket_with_options`
- [x] `auto-reconnect` in case of `Close` or `Error` events.
- [x] Example
- [x]  Book: New chapter `websocket`
- [x] Bump `default-struct-builder`

## Demo
[use_websocket_demo.webm](https://github.com/Synphonyte/leptos-use/assets/47693/ab1ee075-c958-469f-82c1-9ad0d8808109)
